com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getAlternateStoreAvailability

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getAlternateStoreAvailability

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getAlternateStoreAvailability(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getAlternateStoreAvailability API returns a list of the ship nodes within a surrounding radius of the address provided, and returns the availability of the Order Lines being evaluated at the nodes returned.

    • Method Detail

      • getAlternateStoreAvailability

        org.w3c.dom.Document getAlternateStoreAvailability(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getAlternateStoreAvailability API returns a list of the ship nodes within a surrounding radius of the address provided, and returns the availability of the Order Lines being evaluated at the nodes returned.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: OrderLine elements must be provided in the input to evaluate for.
        The search criteria provided for node radius must include sufficient input to derive the location, either a ZipCode or City/State.

        Post-conditions: If no ShipNodes are located in the radius provided, no OrderLines will be returned in the output.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Additional Information:
        The api will first execute the getSurroundingNodeList logic to retrieve back the list of nodes in a region utilizing the, radius and fulfillment types provided. Assuming there are node returned, the order lines or items will be evaluated depending on the mode provided in the input. If NodeList element with Node information is passed in the input, in this case this api will not execute getSurroundingNodeList logic and will work on the passed list of nodes (validation for nodes will not be done and all the values passed in the input for Node will be returned as it is in the output).

        • 01 - Call getFulfillmentOptionsForLines to evaluate the inventory at each node for each order line utilizing the order line as input.
        • 02 - Call getAvailableInventory for each node / item combination and return back the available quantity at each node.
        • 03 - Call findInventory for each node / item combination and return back the earliest available date the requested quantity of each order line can be retrieved.



        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains the node search criteria and the item / order line information required to evaluate the availability. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the list of nodes discovered, and a list of order lines that contain the availability for each node retrieved output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
